meanings.definition: To place or fit into a slot.
meanings.sent1: She was slotting the puzzle pieces together.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys slotting books onto the shelf in alphabetical order.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept slotting the wrong shapes into the holes, causing a funny mess.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were slotting into place like a perfectly solved jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was slotting the gears with precision, like a skilled craftsman at work.

meanings.definition: The act of assigning or allocating something to a particular slot or position.
meanings.sent1: The slotting of tasks in the schedule was meticulous.
meanings.sent2: She excelled in the slotting of responsibilities among team members.
meanings.sent3: The slotting of snacks in the vending machine seemed like a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The slotting of players in the team was strategic, like pieces on a chessboard.
meanings.sent5: His expertise in the slotting of items on the grocery store shelves was unmatched.

meanings.sent1: The coin got stuck in the narrow slotting of the piggy bank.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a tiny bug crawling out of the slotting in the wall.
meanings.sent3: The slotting in the fence was so small that even the cat couldn't squeeze through.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight peeked through the slotting in the curtains, creating a pattern on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The old door had intricate slotting along its edges, adding to its antique charm.
